results.name: a(n) = 2^n - (2*n+1).
comment: This appears as the exponent in Krotov, who writes on p. 2: "in general, two extended Hamming codes can intersect in 2^(2^m - 2m - 1) elements." - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Jan 13 2013
Primes appear at positions n = 4, 7, 8, 28, 32, 81, 669, 1108, ... . - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 22 2013
link: Denis Krotov, A partition of the hypercube into cosets of maximally nonparallel Hamming codes, arXiv:1210.0010v1 [cs.IT], Sep 28, 2012.
